metadata.title: Friday, 21st February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when the Government will officially announce the lifting of the ban on the trade in pork and pork products which was imposed following the outbreak of African Swine Fever in 2013.

parts: (a) why the value of the Kwacha has continued to depreciate against major currencies such as the United States Dollar despite assurances by the Government to stabilise it; and
(b) what measures the Government is taking to curb further depreciation.

parts: (a) when construction of a boarding secondary school in Chasefu Parliamentary Constituency will commence; and

NOTICE OF MOTION The Minister of Finance Increase Amount Outstanding at Any One Time on Domestic Loans: That, in terms of Sections 3 and 15 of the Loans and Guarantees (Authorisation) Act, Chapter 366 of the Laws of Zambia, this House authorises the Minister of Finance to increase by Statutory Instrument:

(i) the maximum amount outstanding at any one time on domestic loans raised within the Republic and payable over a period of not more than one year from two hundred million kwacha (K200,000,000) to thirteen billion kwacha (K13,000,000,000); (ii) the maximum amount outstanding at any one time on domestic loans raised within the Republic and payable over a period of more than one year from ten million kwacha (K10,000,000) to twenty billion kwacha (K20,000,000,000); (iii) the total contingent liability at any one time in respect of guarantees given in terms of section 14 of the Loans and Guarantees (Authorisation) Act, Chapter 366 of the Laws of Zambia to persons ordinarily resident in Zambia, from two hundred million kwacha (K200,000,000) to two billion kwacha (K2,000,000,000); and (iv) the total contingent liability at any one time in respect of guarantees given in terms of section 14 of the Loans and Guarantees (Authorisation) Act, Chapter 366 of the Laws of Zambia to persons ordinarily resident outside Zambia from two billion kwacha (K2,000,000,000) to five billion kwacha (K5,000,000,000).
